sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set constructed by removing the middle third of each closed interval in the interval [0, 1] (i.e. the Cantor ternary set)?
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor ternary set can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension = log(N) / log(1/r)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and r is the scaling factor.

For the Cantor ternary set, at each step, the interval is divided into 3 equal parts, and the middle third is removed, leaving 2 self-similar pieces (N = 2). The scaling factor is 3, as each remaining piece is 1/3 the size of the original interval (r = 3).

So, the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor ternary set is:

Hausdorff dimension = log(2) / log(3) â‰ˆ 0.6309
